name: A Room with a View
summary: Room with a View is a simple space with a wonderful view out onto the bush reserve.
description: Room with a View is a simple space with a wonderful view out onto the bush reserve.
house_rules: - We live in a quite neighbourhood so no noise after 10pm please. - Street parking only (Free)
host_about:
Passionate about family, friends and the environment.  
We are a blessed living on the edge of a beautiful bush reserve.  Morning light fills the Sydney Angophora trees from the East to begin a new day in bush tranquillity.  We enjoy sharing the best of what Sydney has to offer here in Riverview with family, friends and new visitors to our home.

name: The Bay - Beautiful Studio 200m from Pittwater
summary: Instagram: @thebay.airbnb The Bay allows you to escape to beautiful Bayview on the Northern Beaches.  The studio flat is only 200 metres to the shores of Pittwater on a quiet street.  Newly renovated kitchen and bathroom - a perfect couple's retreat. You can enjoy the quietness of Bayview with the fabulous walks along the shoreline to cafes and restaurants, or a 4 minute drive to Mona Vale shops, cafes and restaurants and a little further to fabulous Mona Vale Beach.
space: The flat is situated underneath our family home. Included is a newly renovated fully equipped kitchen and bathroom, Sheridan sheets and towels, Nespresso coffee, Micro-wave, home-made muesli and bread/toast and eggs for the perfect morning breakfast.  Please enjoy a complimentary bottle of red wine on your first evening.  The flat is light and breezy with two door access, dining table inside and also outside under cover.  We have included a picnic basket and blanket.   We also have Netflix, Stan, ABC iView, SBS On Demand, 7Plus, 9Now, 10Play.   Although the flat does not have direct views to Pittwater the outlook is very private and peaceful.
description: Instagram: @thebay.airbnb The Bay allows you to escape to beautiful Bayview on the Northern Beaches.  The studio flat is only 200 metres to the shores of Pittwater on a quiet street.  Newly renovated kitchen and bathroom - a perfect couple's retreat. You can enjoy the quietness of Bayview with the fabulous walks along the shoreline to cafes and restaurants, or a 4 minute drive to Mona Vale shops, cafes and restaurants and a little further to fabulous Mona Vale Beach. The flat is situated underneath our family home. Included is a newly renovated fully equipped kitchen and bathroom, Sheridan sheets and towels, Nespresso coffee, Micro-wave, home-made muesli and bread/toast and eggs for the perfect morning breakfast.  Please enjoy a complimentary bottle of red wine on your first evening.  The flat is light and breezy with two door access, dining table inside and also outside under cover.  We have included a picnic basket and blanket.   We also have Netflix, Stan, ABC iView, SBS On Demand,
neighborhood_overview: At the end of our street is a wonderful Cafe - 8 Knots at Gibsons Marina.  Just outside our home is a breathtaking view of Pittwater right up to Lion Island.  Bayview also offers a Thai restaurant and kayak/SUP hire.  The picturesque Church Point is only 2.5 kilometres away - an easy flat walk.  We are only 8 kms from the beautiful Ku-ring-gai National Park offering many varied walks.   Mona Vale Beach is a 5 minute drive and there are coastal walks both north and south with fabulous views of our coastline.   Whether you are looking for a quiet weekend or lots of activities, The Bay has it all.  You'll leave feeling invigorated and refreshed.
transit: There is a bus service from the city to Mona Vale, the B-Line double decker bus, then change to B156 to Bayview tennis courts.  We are a short walk up the hill.  Other buses head up to Palm Beach or south to Manly (where you can catch a ferry to the city).   We have ample street parking.  All Northern Beaches villages and beaches are only a short drive away.
access: You will have full access to the backyard, which includes a bench seat with cushions - should you wish to relax with partial views, the hammock outside the Studio and herbs should you wish to throw some in your morning omelette.
interaction: We will be on the property and available for anything you need during your stay, but we respect your privacy.
house_rules: - No noise after 10pm - Please let us know if you'd like to have people over We live in a very quiet area and we do ask our guests to respect our neighbours. Thank you.
host_about:
Our family has lived in Bayview for 19 years and Geoff and I love our suburb! Our children are now independent, we have more time on our hands and so have renovated our private self-contained flat for use by guests.  
We love the outdoors and what the Northern Beaches has to offer.  We completed the 50km Coastrek coastal walk from Palm Beach to Balmoral, which highlighted how beautiful the Northern Beaches coastline is.  We live an active life including cycling through the National Park.  We also enjoy relaxing in our tranquil suburb and often pack some champagne and nibbles and drive 10 minutes to the National Park at McCarrs Creek Reserve for a quite afternoon picnic. Needless to say we enjoy great food with a glass of wine and enjoy meeting people, having both worked overseas. 

Our family motto is balance and fun.  We look forward to hosting you and showing off Bayview!

name: Engelen Moore designed 1 bedroom + parking
summary: "The Grid" Architecturally designed (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) yswater Road is a high end designer apartment with a light and airy open plan layout flowing out to a north facing balcony with leafy pool outlooks. Perfect for weekend visitors, duo or solo adventures or business travellers. Step out the front door and it's a short stroll to the foreshore of Rushcutters Bay on spectacular Sydney Harbour. Home of the world-famous Sydney Hobart Yacht Race as well as Potts Point's array of fine eateries & wine bars.

neighborhood_overview: Wonderfully located on Victoria Street in Potts Point. Potts Point is Sydney's most cosmopolitan neighbourhood (think Soho London, The East Village NYC). Victoria Street is unique. Lined with beautiful trees, it starts at the Harbour and is filled with cafes and restaurants. During the last decade Potts Point has become recognised as one of the most desirable places to live in Sydney. Many empty-nesters have sold their family homes in the suburbs and bought an apartment in the neighbourhood. Many young families now choose to live here, so much so that the sight of prams, once as rare in Potts Point as koalas, are now part of the diverse mix of locals. And why wouldn't anybody want to live here? It is the most cosmopolitan 'hood' in Australia. It is beautiful, grand old art deco buildings and harbour side parks; it is a walk to the city through the Botanic Gardens; you can get a coffee downstairs, and have a drink after dinner. It is all about amenity. It is a vibrant, living, inner-urb
notes: Parking. Parking is subject to availability. The cost is $25 per day and must be booked at the time of your reservation.
transit: It is one minute walk to the nearest train station (Kings Cross) or you can walk into the CBD in fifteen minutes. There is a goget car for hire by the hour on the street. Harbour-side parks are 5 minutes walk. The surf beaches are also a short train/ bus ride away. Within walking distance of the Botanic Gardens, Opera House, Art Gallery, Australian Museum, central business district & most tourist sites  AIRPORT: - Taxis takes about 20 minutes and cost about $50 (depending on the time of day).  - Shuttle bus stops at nearby hotels. This costs approx. $14 but takes much longer as it makes a number of stops. - Train. Domestic Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.22 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station - Train. International Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.81 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station
access: Guests have access to everything in the apartment and direct access to the best food and drink Sydney has to offer.
interaction: I like to welcome Guests and show them their accommodation. My family and I live in the next street, so I am close by if Guests need something.
house_rules: ★ Prior to the day of your check-in, ONLY CONTACT ME via the Airbnb message thread. Keeping your booking requirements here in one place keeps me organised. ★ Arrival and Departure times. Please advise: • your estimated ARRIVAL time in Sydney, and • your planned DEPARTURE time from the apartment (checkout is before 11am) I need the times for your convenience so I can plan check-ins and schedule cleanings. If I do not know the times in advance or you are delayed without contacting me, your check-in maybe POSTPONED till later in the evening. ★ Check out. Leave the apartment as you found it is probably the best guide. Please: • wash dishes • take out rubbish • leave used towels in the shower • close windows • put things away (hairdryers, plates, pots etc) • turn off lights and air-conditioning • leave BOTH sets of keys IN the apartment. • message me to say you have left ★ Sheets and towels. Please DO NOT wash the sheets and towels before your departure. I appreciate the effort, but I prefe
host_about:
My family and I live in Potts Point. We love it and think it is the best neighbourhood in Sydney. It is full of life - cafes, restaurants, bars, markets, shops and parks. If Potts Point does not have it, it is nearby by foot, taxi or public transport. It is rated as the most liveable part of Sydney.

We like to travel. I have been fortunate enough to live in Singapore (Tanglin School), France (Dijon - Universite di Bourgogne), Holland (Delft), Italy (Perugia - Universita per Stranieri), UK (London), PNG (Moresby) and Germany (Hamburg). Our experience in travelling and living abroad has been distilled into our apartments.

Airbnb gives us the opportunity to offer to you the five homes we own (not just manage) in this neighbourhood for your stay in Sydney.

All our homes are well designed, comfortable, clean, secure and fully equipped with everything you will need to enjoy your holiday or business trip. We live a minute away so we are available should you need something.

HELPFUL TIP: If you are new to Airbnb, and have not yet completed your profile, it is highly recommended by both Airbnb and myself, that you do. If this is not completed prior to contacting me, then please take the time to introduce yourself in your first contact message when sending in an inquiry or booking request. We would like to know who is coming to our homes. 

The homes we have on Airbnb can be found below.

name: Great Harbour house for 6 - close to City.
summary: The house has a 180 degree harbour view over Berrys Bay ,out to Sydney CBD and Darling Harbour.  Ideally located  in a quiet, safe cul de sac, with free street parking using Council permits , or  5- 10  mins walk to Waverton or Nth Sydney train stations; 3 and 2 stops from City.  Ferries and motorway are nearby. The house is close to Harbour Bridge, Luna Park, NYE fireworks, cafes and shops. Relax on the balcony or walk  the Harbour foreshore, enjoy the views and fab parks.  The choice is yours!
space: * Stay in a quiet,safe  Harbourside location but only  minutes from the CBD *180 degree sweeping  Harbour views over Berrys Bay and across to Barangaroo and   Darling Harbour  * Relax and watch all the ferries, sailing boats, cruise ships and  city skyline,    *Watch Darling Harbour fireworks from the balcony *Walk 15 mins to Harbour Bridge and watch the spectacular NYE fireworks  * Metres to the Harbour foreshore, for walks  along the Harbour to  Luna Park, Harbour Bridge, parks and protected Ball's Head *Close to parks, cafes, restaurants, supermarkets and shops * 5-10 min walk to trains; 2-3 stops from city * Modern home with large living spaces * Outdoor balcony with stunning Harbour and cityscape views * Separate TV/ Entertainment room with large digital TV and DVD * TV streaming services including Netflix * Separate sound system for CD's * Modern kitchen with dishwasher, oven and  microwave *3 large bedrooms all with Queen size beds *2 Bathrooms, one with spa bath *Free high spee

Ideally located  in a quiet, safe cul de sac, with free street parking using Council permits , or  5- 10  mins walk to Waverton or Nth Sydney train stations; 3 and 2 stops from City. The choice is yours! * Stay in a quiet,safe  Harbourside location but only  minutes from the CBD *180 degree sweeping  Harbour views over Berrys Bay and across to Barangaroo and   Darling Harbour  * Relax and watch all the ferries, sailing boats, cruise ships and  city skyline,    *Watch Darling Harbour fireworks from the balcony *Walk 15 mins to Harbour Bridge and watch the spectacular NYE fireworks  * Metres to the Harbour foreshore, for walks  along the Harbour to  Luna Park, Harbour Bridge, parks and protected
neighborhood_overview: The ultimate  safe  and close location for visiting Sydney, our house is located on the water's edge of Sydney Harbour in quiet Berry's Bay, one bay away from the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Watch the Darling Harbour fireworks from  the balcony or walk 15 minutes to the Harbour Bridge or Kirribilli and get the spectacular views of the New Years Eve fireworks. Walk out our door and  you will be on the Harbour foreshore and near to cafes and Waverton Park and the nearby  protected headland of Ball's Head. Sit on our balcony and enjoy some wine or if you're feeling  active talk a walk or a jog  around the area , over the Bridge  to the Rocks or to the City. We love this location... Sydney's best is on the doorstep and  if you stay here , you too will be able to soak up  all the wonderful things Sydney has to offer
transit: Everything is convenient here as you are close to two train stations with only 2 stops to Wynyard and the CBD. If you are driving the main Motorway leading out of Sydney  to the Blue Mountains,  Canberra or the coast is also only  a few streets away making the exit out of Sydney  stress free.
access: Superb location close to  many Sydney attractions; - 15 mins walk to Harbour Bridge, Luna Park - 15 mins walk to spectacular NYE fireworks  - 10 mins to City , Opera House, the  Rocks and Darling Harbour  by train  ( run every 6 minutes during weekdays) - 15 mins walk to local ferries to travel up and down the Harbour to Manly, Homebush Olympic Park  or Parramatta Getting here from the airport is easy via train direct from Airport to Wynyard and change for the 2 stops to North Sydney or  3 stops to  Waverton. Then a 5-10 minute walk to our house.
interaction: We try to welcome and orientate our guests on arrival  at the house and provide support for an easy and comfortable stay. We do leave the property for the full use of our guests.
house_rules: Our house is immaculate and we expect guests to leave the house in the condition that they find it on arrival. We expect guests to respect the neighbours, limiting noise and behaving appropriately.
host_location: McMahons Point, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
My wife and I are retired (ex Management Consultant and Teacher). 
We take the opportunity to travel within and outside Australia when we don't have grandchildren duties.
While we are away, we are listing our Sydney Harbourside house at certain times of the year. We love living so close to the harbour and city and hope our guests enjoy staying here as much as we do.

name: Ground floor beach pad - direct beach access
summary: Located on the ground floor of a small block with private beach access, this apartment is the ONLY apartment in Freshwater where you can step DIRECTLY out onto the beach without having to walk down steps or cross a road. Perfect for families with small children.
space: We love our place because of its contemporary modern design and flexible inside-outside living and entertaining space. Air -conditioning throughout. Floor to wall glass doors open to an oversized terrace capturing spectacular vistas over Freshwater Beach through to North Head. The gourmet kitchen has stone bench tops with stainless steel Miele appliances . The two double bedrooms are fitted with ceiling fans, with the main featuring his and hers walk-in robe and luxurious ensuite. The sparkling contemporary main bathroom is equipped with designer fixtures and fittings. Conveniently located a short stroll to Freshwater Village, cafes, eateries and transport to Manly and Sydney's CBD.

Conveniently located a short stroll to Freshwater Village, cafes, eateries and transport to Manly and Sydney's CBD. Freshwater beach is mere footsteps away and t
neighborhood_overview: Freshwater is a thriving village with a great community feel. Only a short stroll from its busier neighbour Manly, its a great place to escape the crowds while still having all the amenities that you need. Whilst 2 supermarkets are currently being constructed int he village, there are still plenty of designer shops, a pharmacy, 2 bakeries, cafes and restaurants for you to enjoy. Bars include the Stowaway, Beach Hotel and the Harbord Diggers RSL.  Many people consider Freshwater beach to be the best beach on the Northern Beaches. Its relatively mellow swell and shallow waters make it ideal for those with young children. The beach is patrolled by lifeguards every day from October to April.
notes: While the unit does not come with an allocated parking space, we are happy to lend you our council parking permit. This allows you to park in any of the council car parks ANYWHERE on the Northern Beaches for FREE - including Freshwater Beach car park, located just across the road from the unit.
transit: Manly is a short walk over the headland. The 139 bus also stops on Evans Street (in front of the Harbord Diggers RSL) and is a quick 10 minute hop to Manly. There is a gorgeous boardwalk along the Freshwater - Curl Curl coast that is highly recommended for a stroll.
access: Freshwater beach is mere footsteps away and the floodlit Olympic sized ocean pool is about a 100m walk from the front door. Lush Freshwater Reserve is located in front of the apartment and offers ideal picnic and BBQ spots,  a children's playground as well as a perfect space for kicking a ball about. Recently, the Harbord Diggers re-opened across the road to the rear of our building. It has 4 restaurants, 1 bar and a children's play area all overlooking Curl Curl beach. There is absolutely no noise affecting our unit as we are at the front of building, facing the ocean.
interaction: I endeavour to answer queries within 24 hours
host_about: I have lived in Dublin, London and Dubai but for the last 10 years have called the Northern Beaches of Sydney my home. I love the outdoors and everything Sydney has to offer. I enjoy ocean swimming, running, skiing, cycling, yoga and triathlon. With friends and family all over the world, I am fortunate to do a lot travelling. I love exploring new places, meeting people of all nationalities and experiencing local cuisines.

name: Fun & Eclectic 2 Bedroom pad in Inner City Suburb
summary: Fun & eclectic two bedroom apartment within a secure complex, surrounded by Balinese gardens. It has a lounge room with a daybed, and a fully equipped kitchen with a dining table. We are on the border of Waterloo/Redfern which is in an inner city suburb, between the airport and the city.  Surry Hills / city is a 25 minute walk or a 7 minute bus. It is one quick train to The Opera House and The Rocks from Redfern Station (12 min walk). Only a quick stroll to many arty cafes and bars.
space: This place is fantastic for friends or a couple wanting a quiet escape after a big day of sight seeing. It is not a party place, and we encourage guests to make minimal noise as not to disturb the neighbours. PLEASE CHECK OUT OUR OTHER LISTINGS IN THE SAME COMPLEX IF YOUR DATES ARE NOT AVAILABLE OR IF YOU HAVE A LARGE TRAVEL PARTY! :) THEY ARE ALL AMAZING!

This place is fantastic for friends or a couple wanting a quiet escape after a big day of sight seeing. It is not a party place, and we encourage guests to make minimal noise as not to disturb the neighbours. PLEASE CHECK OUT OUR OTHER LISTINGS IN THE SAME COMPLEX IF YOUR DATES ARE NOT AVAILABLE OR IF YOU HAVE A LARGE TRAVEL PARTY! :) THEY ARE ALL AMAZING! The whole apartment will be yours for the time booked. The garden outside is shared with two other apartments (rarely used by them!). We like to give our
neighborhood_overview: Redfern/Waterloo is an inner city suburb that hasn't quite been gentrified yet, so it's got an interesting mix of locals, old and new. We have many great little cafes and bars to check out. John Smith Cafe is a 1 minute walk and does great coffee and food. For drinks, The Cauliflower is a few doors away, our local pub with nightly specials and a tiki bar upstairs! We love 'The Bearded Tit', 'Arcadia', 'Misfits' and 'Redfern Surf Club' - All fantastic options and all within walking distance!
transit: There is a bus stop opposite 'The Cauliflower Hotel' which takes you into Surry Hills / Central Station fairly quickly. They come every 10 mins or so. You can walk to Redfern Station which is 12 mins. An Uber from the airport will cost about $18 and take 15 minutes.
access: The whole apartment will be yours for the time booked. The garden outside is shared with two other apartments (rarely used by them!).
interaction: We like to give our guests space but are available if they need anything at all.
house_rules: No excessive noise after 10pm No smoking in outdoor garden Please ask permission if you wish to invite guests over. If not we will assume they are staying and an extra fee will be charged.
host_about: Leenie and Erick are life lovers. We travel a lot. Both artists, Leenie works in the music/film industry and Erick is an Interior Stylist/Designer and actor. Home is a sanctuary. We are clean and considerate. Leenie is a coffee snob. Erick is hilarious. Together, they salsa up a storm.

name: Twin light and bright large room with balcony
summary: Large double bedroom with 2 king single beds with french doors onto balcony overlooking garden and Coogee. Room is brand new as has recently been added on in a renovation. With shared brand new bathroom located right next to the room.
space: The space - Double queen room with 2 brand new king single beds and wardrobe and drawers. Suits two or one guests. Very light airy space with high ceilings.Has french doors leading onto private balcony looking over garden and Coogee views. Brand new carpet too. Door is lockable from the inside. The bathroom - is shared but brand new with walk in shower. My home - beautiful terrace house newly renovated in leafy quiet street.  I also have a beautiful garden you are welcome to sit in and have breakfast. Linen and towels provided and toiletries and hairdryer. Tea coffee and breakfast staples are provided. Wifi throughout house.

I also have a beautiful garden you are welcome to sit in and have breakfast. Linen and towels provided and toiletries and hairdryer. Tea coffee and breakfast staples are provided. Wifi throughout house. You are welcome to share the kitchen facilities with everything ! Also its an eat in kitchen with dining table you may also watch TV
neighborhood_overview: The terrace house is located in a quiet, safe street. Only a 10 minute walk up to Randwick shops or 15 minute walk to Coogee beach. A 2 minute walk to a great cafe and Thai restaurant, Coogee and Randwick also full of cafes pubs and restaurants easy walk home after.
notes: We have street parking with no permit needed and no time restrictions. I also have a cat Mila a British Blue Shorthair that everybody loves ! I have my whole house (4 bedrooms) listed too and I am a superhost if you want to check my other listing out.
transit: 2 minute walk to public transport and buses to Sydney center and Circular Quay. 15 minute to Coogee beach and also not far from Bondi and Bronte beaches. A great base for discovering Sydney.
access: You are welcome to share the kitchen facilities with everything ! Also its an eat in kitchen with dining table you may also watch TV/netflix in the living room with us. I provide tea and coffee always and breakfast items upon request. You may also use washing machine/ iron etc.
interaction: Interaction with guests - we can socialise or not, up to you. I live here with my 2 boys 9 and 12 but they are also at their Dads house every weekend.
host_about: I am originally from England and moved to Sydney 2001. I work in hospitality and love, love living in Sydney and can give you heaps of great tips for a great holiday ! I love my home and l enjoy  making it special for my two little boys. I enjoy travelling, food and wine, hanging out at the beach, camping  and a good times !

The generously sized kitchen has a gas stove top and electric oven, microwave, entertainers fridge including ice maker/water. name: 1 Bedroom Place with Water Views & Free Parking
summary: Our well presented and comfortable 1 bedroom apartment has all the amenities you would ever need for your stay. With Panaromic Views of Parramatta River. The vIew from our place will take your breath away. Our place is also situated a 5 minute drive or bus ride to Sydney Olympic Park which is a great advantage if you are visiting to see a Concert or a Show in Qudos Bank Arena or to watch a Sporting Event in ANZ Stadium or many of the other Sporting Facilities located in Sydney Olympic Park.
space: Our Comfortable and Brand New 1 Bedroom Apartment is perfect for Business Travellers, & Couples. Suitable for up to 3 Adults or 2 Adults and 2 Children. Both the Living Room & Main Bedroom are abundant with natural light with glass windows from floor to ceiling. The Bedroom and living room have panaromic views of the Parramatta River. The Bedroom bares a Queen Size Bed. The Living Room has a 4-Seater Sofa with Large Flat Screen TV. Air Conditioning throughout the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located in the heart of Wentworth Point. Being an affluent and mostly residential neighbourhood, the environment is very safe and comfortable. With great Restaurants and Shopping just minutes walk away. With lovely walks along the water and parklands of the area it is a truly relaxing place to stay.
notes: No Smoking is allowed inside the apartment, smokers can use the balcony for smoking. Strictly No Pets.  No parties or events. Remember that it is an apartment so respect our neighbours by keeping the noise down. Please keep the place tidy and leave it the same way you received it. Dispose of all rubbish in small bags and place them in the rubbish chute located in the exterior hall. All kitchen ware is to be cleaned and left to dry. Please refer to the house rules for more information.
transit: Access to Rhodes Train Station is conveniently located just 10 minutes walk. Pierside Shopping Centre in Wentworth Point is only a stones throw away which has an IGA Supermarket and many Restaurants and Services. Rhodes Waterside Shopping Centre is just a short 15 minute walk from our apartment. There are also other transport links close by. Sydney Olympic Park Wharf is only 4 minutes walk and you can catch a Ferry into the City, Barangaroo, Circular Quay or Parramatta. There is also a free bus service to Rhodes Train Station & Sydney Olympic Park that stops outside our place. Inside Rhodes Wasterside Shopping Centre there is a Coles Supermarket, IKEA, Target, Bing Lee, Cinemas, Food Court and many Restaurants, Cafes and other Services all inside the centre.
access: You will have access to our Entire Place. An Underground Secure Car Space, 1 Bedroom with all Linen provided, Bedding, Towels and Hand Towels. 1 Bathroom with Toiletries, Hair Dryer, Shampoo, Shower Gel, Hand Wash and Toilet Paper all provided. Large Open Kitchen and Dining area, Living Room with Large Flat Screen TV withgreat views. Air Conditioning throughout. Washer/Dryer Combo, Dishwasher, Microwave, Cooktop, Oven, Kettle, Toaster, tableware, glassware, cutlery and cooking utensils are provided.
interaction: You can contact us if there are any enquiries via Phone or Airbnb message. Don’t hesitate to contact us, we are very familiar with the local area and are always happy to help with anything from something within our apartment to something as simple as a restaurant recommendation or help with directions in the local area.

name: The Heart of Manly
summary: Welcome to the ideal luxury family holiday house only 800m from the heart of Manly and all it has to offer with its’ beautiful beaches, wharf and cafe lifestyle.
space: The Heart of Manly is a brilliant 4 bedroom house offering all of the comforts that you would expect in a house of this quality. As you enter the house, you are immediately welcomed into a light filled open planned Kitchen and living area that flows onto a travertine tiled patio and pool with water feature. The main level of the house also has the rear TV lounge room and out to the rear courtyard and garden. The perfect outdoor area for evening meals cooked up on the BBQ. The top floor has all of the accommodation. The master bedroom with a luxury open bathroom ensuite, dressing room and balcony overlooking the pool with sea views. There are three further double bedrooms and family bathroom upstairs plus an additional shower room downstairs. Also on the main level of the house is an office that can also be used as a 5th bedroom if required. name: Delightful home with extensive harbour views
summary: Spacious light filled home tastefully restored in a special heritage enclave of Sydney on the harbour foreshore. Very quiet home, bright and airy during the day and atmospheric in the evening.  Featuring expansive views of the harbor, city and Cockatoo Island. A very short stroll to nearby restaurants including the iconic Woolwich Pier Pub.  10 minute walk to city ferry.
space: The home consists of two levels. On the ground floor is a large sunny living area opening to paved and leafy garden – a lovely oasis.  Quality kitchen/laundry appliances.  Master bedroom with Queen bed capturing stunning views.  Sitting room with large cot/toddler bed.  Spacious modern bathroom.  Gorgeous front verandah with extensive views of the harbour – it will comfortably seat 8 and has a new gas barbeque.  Upstairs two bedrooms, one with Queen bed and the other King single  Generous living space with double sofa bed.  Top quality linen. Nespresso coffee machine Very fast Wi-Fi Netflix,  Plex and Foxtel There is ample street parking and onsite parking for small car.
description: Spacious light filled home tastefully restored in a special heritage enclave of Sydney on the harbour foreshore. Very quiet home, bright and airy during the day and atmospheric in the evening.  Featuring expansive views of the harbor, city and Cockatoo Island. A very short stroll to nearby restaurants including the iconic Woolwich Pier Pub.  10 minute walk to city ferry. The home consists of two levels. On the ground floor is a large sunny living area opening to paved and leafy garden – a lovely oasis.  Quality kitchen/laundry appliances.  Master bedroom with Queen bed capturing stunning views.  Sitting room with large cot/toddler bed.  Spacious modern bathroom.  Gorgeous front verandah with extensive views of the harbour – it will comfortably seat 8 and has a new gas barbeque.  Upstairs two bedrooms, one with Queen bed and the other King single  Generous living space with double sofa bed.  Top quality linen. Nespresso coffee machine Very fast Wi-Fi Netflix,  Plex and Foxtel There is a

name: Large Balmain Townhouse 1 Ferry stop from CBD
summary: Our townhouse is located close to the bustling heart of Balmain, with its Pubs, Restaurants, Cafes, and only a short walk to all of Balmain's attractions. It is very light and spacious, with high ceilings, and a fully equipped kitchen. There is a security garage, with a rear entrance to the courtyard. It has views to the city and the Harbour Bridge, and it is only either a 600 metre walk to the Thames St wharf, or a 1 km walk to the East Balmain wharf, to get to the city via our magical harbour.
space: The lounge, dining, kitchen, and courtyard are all on the open plan ground floor, with an adjoining laundry/bathroom. At the rear there is a  courtyard flowing from the kitchen, which faces the northerly sun. There are 2 sun beds, should you wish to soak some up. In high summer we do have a large umbrella to protect you. There is a gas BBQ should you wish to do some outdoor cooking.  Every room, including all the bathrooms, get an abundance of natural light, and there is reverse cycle air conditioning on each floor, powered by a large roof-top solar array. The hot water is also solar heated. The home theatre has a 3 metre screen, and the  lounge seats 6-8. We have Apple TV, Netflix, plus an internet TV recorder available. Computer connection to the large screen is possible via HDMI or Vga cable, or Apple Airplay.  There are two queen bedrooms on the first floor. One has an ensuite bathroom with shower/bath, WC, and basin. In addition it has a walk-in wardrobe and a large sunny verandah
description: Our townhouse is located close to the bustling heart of Balmain, with its Pubs, Restaurants, Cafes, and only a short walk to all of Balmain's attractions. It is very light and spacious, with high ceilings, and a fully equipped kitchen. There is a security garage, with a rear entrance to the courtyard. It has views to the city and the Harbour Bridge, and it is only either a 600 metre walk to the Thames St wharf, or a 1 km walk to the East Balmain wharf, to get to the city via our magical harbour. The lounge, dining, kitchen, and courtyard are all on the open plan ground floor, with an adjoining laundry/bathroom. At the rear there is a  courtyard flowing from the kitchen, which faces the northerly sun. There are 2 sun beds, should you wish to soak some up. In high summer we do have a large umbrella to protect you. There is a gas BBQ should you wish to do some outdoor cooking.  Every room, including all the bathrooms, get an abundance of natural light, and there is reverse cycle air condi
neighborhood_overview: Balmain was one of the earliest suburbs in Sydney becoming a major port, wharf and coal mining area in the 1800’s. This has made Balmain into a colourful, artistic peninsula. Its architecture reminds us of its working class background with its beautifully preserved ‘workers cottages’ and a very large number of pubs. In fact it is known as the peninsula of pubs. The Bald Rock Hotel, built in 1876 is the longest continually licensed pub in the area and is 1.2 km walk away. The London Pub, 50 metres away, has a street lining balcony, which bursts with Balmain-ians meeting for their after work drinks. Dicks, The Exchange, The Royal Oak, The Dry Dock, The East Village, The Unity Hall, The Cricketers Arms and The Town Hall pubs are all within a 600 metre walk, & all are great options for a drink or a meal.
notes: This is a residential block of 4 townhouses with the majority of owners living on site. We do expect our guests to be very considerate of all of our neighbours and to respect their right to enjoy their home without disturbance.
transit: The townhouse is about 30 metres from bus stops to either the CBD, or to Balmain East Wharf, where you can catch a ferry to Circular Quay at the northern end of the CBD, or alternatively, in the other direction, to Darling Harbour, with its Maritime museum, Powerhouse museum, Zoo, Aquarium, Casino, restaurants, and bars.
access: An 600m stroll along Darling Street will take you past more than 40 cafes and restaurants. Whether you like Thai, Vietnamese, Indian, Italian, Japanese, Greek, Mexican, Spanish, or Aussie, you will be able to find one that suits your taste. On the stroll you will also pass a huge variety of lovely little boutiques, bread and pastry shops, butchers, green grocers, supermarkets, and wine, beer & spirits merchants.
house_rules: We expect our guests to be mindful of our neighbours, & not disturb them between the hours of 10pm & 7am.

notes: Summer outdoor eating is a must - there is nothing better than a balmy summer night to just throw a steak and and some prawns or local fish on the barbie after a twilight swim, to sit back and enjoy a bottle of wine.

host_about:
We are a family of 4 (2 teenage children).  We have used Airbnb quite a lot in the US, France and the UK - all have been great experiences. however this is our first time as hosts.  
We love to travel, and enjoy the food and cultural experience of every country we visit.   We love to live like the locals, and that's what we offer with our home.  We are in North Bondi, away from the tourist track, but close enough to walk to all that encompasses the Bondi lifestyle. We have a great neighbourhood, super friendly and hospitable. I am always very respectful of people's property and will do my best to leave it exactly the same way as we arrived and would expect others to do the same.

summary: Our home a modern, spacious and deliciously comfortable space.  A huge 3 level townhouse with 4 balconies, ensuite in main, views of the city, close to the CBD.  5 minutes walk from the tram and bus, city living surrounded by parks and shops.

name: Manly, Sydney - 1 Bed Apartment
summary: Nestled between Manly Beach and Manly Wharf Beach, our 1 bedroom apartment is a perfect 'home from home' for a couple or single person looking to be minutes away from the buzz of Manly Village. Our apartment has a generous kitchen with fridge freezer, cooker, oven, the essential nutri-bullet and plenty of storage. The living space is a good size, with a TV, sofa and desk. The bedroom has a double bed and plenty of storage. All rooms get good north light. A laundry and dryer are out the back.
description: Nestled between Manly Beach and Manly Wharf Beach, our 1 bedroom apartment is a perfect 'home from home' for a couple or single person looking to be minutes away from the buzz of Manly Village. Our apartment has a generous kitchen with fridge freezer, cooker, oven, the essential nutri-bullet and plenty of storage. The living space is a good size, with a TV, sofa and desk. The bedroom has a double bed and plenty of storage. All rooms get good north light. A laundry and dryer are out the back. You will be able to access the laundry and dryer via the communal rear garden. We have a TV which connects to Netflix - instructions will be left in the flat. There is a large fan that you can move to any room. Flyscreens are fitted on all sash-windows throughout. Manly village centre is minutes walk from the apartment through the park steps and down Sydney Road.
transit: Manly village centre is minutes walk from the apartment through the park steps and down Sydney Road.

name: Coogee Beachside Apartment
summary: Light and bright luxury beachside apartment perfect for families. Spacious, fully equipped and relaxed living one block to Coogee Beach, restaurants and amenities. Available for long term stay over the Sydney summer.
space: Our apartment is only one block to Coogee Beach, has three big bedrooms and will give you a great base from which to explore Sydney during it's bustling summer. Welcome to beautiful Coogee Beach in Sydney's Eastern Suburbs, 8 kilometres from Sydney's CBD. Available is the entire street level of our large apartment in an ideal spot right at Coogee beach, with private entrance at street level. Indoor outdoor living, tiled floors and modern appliances make this the perfect place to spend sunny days. The private apartment has three big bedrooms: One with a king bed, built-in wardrobes, private balcony and ensuite; One with a single bed and trundle and built in wardrobe; and One with a sprung double sofa bed and built-in wardrobe. There are  air conditioners in all rooms including bedrooms and the living room, so the place is the perfect temperature all year round. neighborhood_overview: Coogee Beach, Coogee Pavilion,  shops, supermarket, restaurants and cafes are all five minutes walk. Perfect location for the Coastal Walk, playgrounds, ocean pools and parklands. If you're after nice walks, this is the place. From the apartment you can walk north, from Coogee Beach around the Beach Walk to Gordons Bay. then Clovelly, then Bronte, Tamarama and Bondi. Heading south the walk passes the bays around South Coogee to Maroubra, and you can stick to the water the whole way around. Its pretty awesome. You are one block away from three incredible ocean pools perfect for family swimming.
transit: There are multiple bus lines that service the area, with bus stops very close to the apartment. Sydney's CBD is a 25-30 minute trip by bus (and about the same by car), Bondi Junction is only 10 minutes.
access: All spaces available however personal items are left in the apartment and are to remain untouched.

name: Bronte Luxe. New home- 5 mins walk to two beaches!
summary: Newly renovated, light bright and welcoming home. Our family home- we hope you'll enjoy it as much as we do! 5 minutes walk to Bronte and Tamarama beaches. The Bondi to Bronte walk is the #2 thing to do in Sydney on trip adviser, and you're minutes away from it! 1 minute walk to bus stops taking you to Bondi Beach, Bondi Junction and Clovelly. A leafy green oasis in the backyard- perfect for an Aussie BBQ after a long day at the beach.
space: Newly renovated, light filled, architecturally designed two storey, three bedroom home. Beautiful leafy green back yard, perfect for a summer BBQ. Luxurious designer bathroom. All Miele appliances. Parking. Sonos sound system throughout and a Netflix enabled TV's in lounge and two bedrooms. Ceiling fans in all bedrooms and lounge room with cross flow ventilation keeping the place cool all summer. Gas heater keeping the whole house toasty warm in winter. Childrens toys and beds also available on request. Water glimpses.

neighborhood_overview: Bronte is a family friendly suburb. Previously voted Sydney's best suburb. Park and beach only minutes away. Cafe's, restaurants and nightlife all within walking distance. Bondi Junction shopping centre and train station a short bus ride away.
notes: Please relax and enjoy our home as if it were your home. We know you'll love it as much as we do, but please leave it as you found it, as it is our home! Our home is non- smoking, so please only smoke outside. We'd also prefer it if shoes are not worn inside.
transit: Two bus stops less than a minute walk, taking you to Bondi, Clovelly and Bondi Junction.
access: Whole home access, but please remember that this is our home, and treat is as you would like your own home to be treated!
interaction: Available for recommendations and advice on the best things to see and do for all ages. We grew up here, and have built itineraries and tours for many of our travelling friends and relatives. Any problems and concerns- we're just a phone call away.

name: Spacious and modern Bondi Flat
summary: Summer is here and the best place to be is close to one of the most beautiful beaches in Sydney, the famous Bondi Beach. My partner and I are renting out the spacious second bedroom with separate bathroom to 1-2 guests. Our flat is right on the main road and an easy 10 minute walk down to the beach or up to the junction. There's plenty of cafes, restaurants, and shopping all along the road a nice park up the road. The bus (380,381) stops right out front and the 333 stops just across the street.

neighborhood_overview: Mascot is an inner-city village of Sydney. Only about 2 stops from the Sydney CBD (Central Business District) / Core.  Mascot was once a vital component of Sydney's industrial suburb, with manufactory yards, factories and wool-stores. That history remains and in recent years Mascot has experienced a resurgence with an influx of residents and office workers. Cafés, restaurants, warehouse and outlets for shopping in the neighbourhood.
notes: I may be able to arrange some earlier check ins or later checkouts, but I do need to make those arrangements well in advance. I've been left waiting too many times to be able to make other arrangements… Please talk to me about it *before* you make your reservation.    :)  I'd ask that you'd please not smoke inside the house. I'll give you keys so you can come and go as you need... Please send me ur email (normally the same email u use for iTunes). Or I can share it via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) drive if u prefer.
interaction: As much or as little as you like. My work load can be busy sometimes, so you may see me work from home or won't see much of me until evenings. When I'm around, I'm happy to chat as little or as much as you like. I love meeting people and learning more about the world. I'm open minded, honest, affable and have an immense passion for life, and learning. :)
house_rules: My house rules are very simple: - Please be energy efficient (turn off lights/appliances when not in use)  - Be considerate of–and respectful to–my neighbours  - Keep noise to a minimum  - Be neat and tidy, don't wear shoes inside  - Please don't have food in the bedroom or on the couch  - No pets, smoking inside or parties  - Keep the house locked when you're not at home  - Leave the place as you found it and  - Wash dishes as they are used  - If you don't know where something is - ask.   - If you break something - tell me.   - If you like anything of mine then feel free to say so and I might be able to tell you where to get one of your own!   - Most importantly, enjoy your stay! That's all there is to it :)
host_about:
I love travel, enjoy meeting people. I firstly started my Airbnb when I was travelling in 2015.    

I've been as the host and also as a guest, I have met many interesting people over the world which made my life more enjoyable.

name: Beautiful beachouse mins to Bronte -Clovelly beach
summary: Beautiful beach house in Bronte/Clovelly minutes from beach. You’ll love this place with such close proximity to Clovelly and Bronte beaches. The house itself is light, spacious, private with a lot of sunlight to enjoy.  There is a private backyard filled with sun plus a big shade umbrella for hot sunny days and an outdoor hot/cold shower to use after coming back from a nice day at one of Sydney's best beaches.  Good for couples, business travellers, and families (with kids).
space: 2 story house with 4 furnished bedrooms; 2 bedrooms on the ground floor that are spacious and 2 bedrooms upstairs. It has a huge,  open lounge room,  perfect for relaxing  after walking one of Australia's finest coastal walks, only 4 minutes away. The kitchen is big and the backyard is perfect for bbq's and entertaining. There is 1 main bathroom downstairs + 2 additional toilets and an outside hot/cold shower with bamboo privacy cover. Upstairs there are 2 wonderfully big bedrooms, fully furnished for guests. Both rooms have gorgeous Juliet style balconies (one with very partial views of the ocean) the other overlooking the tranquil backyard. There is also a toilet upstairs. All bedrooms have queen beds.

The kitchen is big and the backyard is perfect for bbq's and entertaining. There is 1 main bathroom downstairs + 2 additional toilets and an outside hot/cold shower with bamboo privacy cover. Upstairs there are 2 wonderfully big bedrooms, fully furnished for guests. Both
neighborhood_overview: We are right between Bronte and Clovelly. Both these beachside suburbs are spectacular. In particular Clovelly is amazing for kids as the beach has an inlet that protects swimmers from waves, whist Bronte is a great beach to enjoy the surf. There are many cafe and corners stores in every direction you. Its a 4 minute walk to the nearest beach, this is also where you can start one of the most famous walks in all of Australia; Bondi - Coggee walk. Sunrise is incredible to watch from the parks overlooking the beach and there is also incredible transport with local Westfield's big shopping centre 25 mins bus ride away or 40mins to the city.
notes: There is also an electronic fireplace in the lounge room opposite the 65inch Ultra HD TV Nespresso coffee machine with pods in kitchen dishwasher, kettle, toaster, big french door fridge and oven. we also have some games, books and DVD's for your to borrow.  Outdoors: there is an 8 seater mediterranean style table with cushions, a love bench, big table umbrella, bbq, gas heater and a tranquil pond with fountain. The backyard has NO neighbours looking in and is very private and relaxing.  There is also an outdoor hot/cold beach shower in the backyard
transit: Many buses to the nearest big shopping Centre; Bondi Junction Westfield's or 40 min bus ride to the city. Centennial park is also about 20mins on a bus which is a spectacular huge park to enjoy. Clovelly Beach is 4min walk, Gordon's Bay is 7 min walk, Coogee is 20 mins walk and Bronte Beach is 20mins walk.
access: entire house, except under roof storage.
host_about: My partner and I live in an incredible big 4 bedroom beach house only a short 4 minute walk to one of the most beautiful beaches in Sydney. Our house instantly feels like home with a huge open lounge room that we use to relax in and watch movies on the big screen. We enjoy beach life and love being outdoors. We are grateful to live in such a fantastic part of sydney and a beautiful house.

name: Log Cabin by the Sea - Pittwater
summary: Our recently renovated log cabin retreat overlooks the beautiful waters of Clareville, Pittwater. Set amongst lush tropical gardens, it is the perfect getaway for couples, small groups or families.
space: The location of the Log Cabin and the interior design is such that it is the perfect location for either a short stay visit or a longer duration spanning weeks or months. To date, we have warmly welcomed Sydney, interstate and international travelers. The Cabin is large enough to be a 'home away from home' whilst international travelers wish to base themselves on the Northern Beaches visiting family or looking to 'trial' the amazing lifestyle of this unique and very special area. Our Log Cabin is set high amongst lush tropical gardens and enjoys filtered views over Pittwater and wonderful sunsets off the deck with a NW aspect. There is a large retractable awning to give shade to the deck in the afternoon sun.  Bird life is prolific and the open plan design of the cabin with two loft bedrooms creates a spacious and peaceful ambiance in a beach side location. The Cabin has been recently renovated to include all the modern comforts one needs:  reverse cycle air conditioning, very comforta
description: Our recently renovated log cabin retreat overlooks the beautiful waters of Clareville, Pittwater. Set amongst lush tropical gardens, it is the perfect getaway for couples, small groups or families. The location of the Log Cabin and the interior design is such that it is the perfect location for either a short stay visit or a longer duration spanning weeks or months. To date, we have warmly welcomed Sydney, interstate and international travelers. The Cabin is large enough to be a 'home away from home' whilst international travelers wish to base themselves on the Northern Beaches visiting family or looking to 'trial' the amazing lifestyle of this unique and very special area. Our Log Cabin is set high amongst lush tropical gardens and enjoys filtered views over Pittwater and wonderful sunsets off the deck with a NW aspect. There is a large retractable awning to give shade to the deck in the afternoon sun.  Bird life is prolific and the open plan design of the cabin with two loft bedrooms
neighborhood_overview: Clareville/Avalon is such a unique neighborhood in Sydney. The proximity to arguably the best beaches in Sydney, coupled with the casual lifestyle of a close knit community, makes it a beautiful place for people to visit and fall in love with. We have found it to be a very safe and friendly place to live. Clareville Kiosk opposite the beach is a must for a special lunch or dinner. There are many great cafes, restaurants and bars in Avalon, beautiful home wares shops to stroll through, a great bookstore and a lovely cinema. Just 10 minutes further north in Palm Beach, there is the iconic Boathouse for breaky or lunch, great Fish & chips, a fantastic walk up to Barrenjoey Lighthouse and ferries that open up the many beautiful beaches of Pittwater and the Central Coast.
notes: Small families are very welcome. The second loft bedroom containing 2 single beds is accessed via a spiral staircase. For safety reasons, we have installed child safety gates top and bottom and we request that this is used for any children under the age of 4 years. To maximise the benefits of open plan living with loft bedrooms - secure, compliant and attractive glass balustrading defines each bedroom. The second loft room (containing 2 single beds) has block-out blinds to provide privacy from the rest of the Cabin. For young children, we have a portable cot with linen, high chair and a toy box as well. All linen is provided including sheets, bathroom and beach towels. In addition to our stand up paddle board and children's surf boards, guests are very welcome to use the beach umbrella.
transit: Our log cabin is directly opposite Pittwater. One can enjoy beautiful walks along the foreshore or access Clareville Reserve in a short 10 minute stroll. We are also situated very close to our local Clareville 'Hilltop' shops and a 20 minute walk into Avalon shopping village. Car access is ideal here, but there is also a bus service (191 & 192) that operates on our street and can take guests into Avalon and on from there.
access: Guests are welcome to enter the property via the driveway access which makes unloading luggage easy as the driveway is steep. Once settled, guests may park here rather than on the street.  Guests are more than welcome to utilise the weber BBQ that we have on the deck and take the stand up paddle board across the road and enjoy the calm waters of Pittwater. We have a selection of children's surf boards that guests are most welcome to take to the beach as well.  Wifi is available as well as IPhone/IPod docking for music. There is a large TV and DVD player and a collection of books, magazines and board games to relax with as well. Whilst the Cabin affords 1 Queen size bed and 2 single beds, we can accomodate an extra guest with a very comfortable mattress and linen. This does incur an additional charge of $50 per night.
interaction: The cabin is situated on the same property as the owners residence, although it is completely separate and private. Where possible, we will always make ourselves available should guests require interaction during their stay, without being intrusive.
house_rules: Respect the space and the neighbours. No Smoking in or near the cabin, no parties and sorry no pets (as much as we love animals!).
host_about: I'm an active mother of two young girls who loves the outdoors and healthy living. I'm hugely passionate about living in beautiful Pittwater and excited about sharing this with new people who come to visit. I'm interested in the creative space and renovating our log cabin as been my latest pursuit! The five things I can't live without are: my family, the beach, good friends, good food and downtime!

name: The Alison - Small Double Room Shared Bathroom
summary: Sydney's answer to a truly local guest house experience! With friendly staff, well appointed rooms and on site parking, The Alison Randwick makes for an affordable stay in one of Sydney's most prestigious neighbourhoods.  Offering various room styles this quaint guest house boasts comfortable boutique rooms with well appointed shared facilities as well private ensuites, The Alison Randwick is sure to accommodate a terrific stay for the solo, corporate, weekend and family traveler.
space: The Alison Randwick's Small Double Rooms with Shared Bathrooms are deluxe room type delivering an home away from home comfort.  Fitted with modern wash basins and boutiques amenities these rooms provide a luxury feel.   In addition to a shared bathroom this room type also features a cozy Double bed, air conditioning, television, tea and coffee brewing facilities, complimentary Wifi, wardrobe and a small bar fridge.   It should be noted that lift access is not available and some rooms are located across one upper levels.  For those who require ground floor accommodation please note that this is dependent on availability and our guest services team will deliver where possible.   All linen, premium bedding, towels and toiletries are provided for guest comfort. Housekeeping offered every second day of your stay ensures all of our valued guests get best the best of both a local experience and a quality accommodation experience.  Hairdryers, power adapters, laundry service and concierge offe

With friendly staff, well appointed rooms and on site parking, The Alison Randwick makes for an affordable stay in one of Sydney's most prestigious neighbourhoods.  Offering various room styles this quaint guest house boasts comfortable boutique rooms with well appointed shared facilities as well private ensuites, The Alison Randwick is sure to accommodate a terrific stay for the solo, corporate, weekend and family traveler. The Alison Randwick's Small Double Rooms with Shared Bathrooms are deluxe room type delivering an home away from home comfort.  Fitted with modern wash basins and boutiques amenities these rooms provide a luxury feel.   In addition to a shared bathroom this room type also features a cozy Double bed, air conditioning, television, tea and coffee brewing facilities, complimentary Wifi, wardrobe and a small bar fridge.   It should be noted that lift access is not available and some rooms are located across one up
neighborhood_overview: The property is within walking distance to the University of NSW (UNSW), the Prince of Wales Hospital and the Sydney Children’s Hospital.  Nearby are the Royal Women’s Hospital, Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG), the Hordern Pavilion and Coogee Beach.   Being in a rich heritage location like Randwick, The Alison Randwick is surrounded by breathtaking architecture and parks, with a short stroll up the road seeing guests greeted by a bubbling hub of activity.  For a change of pace, a walk to The Spot sees  plenty of restaurants, cafes and speciality stores - there's bound to be something to suit everyone.   Today Randwick has become a perfect blend of old meets new.
notes: The leafy surrounds of Randwick provide the perfect back drop for your stay in Sydney.  It is recommended for both long and short term stays being just walking distance from central CBD transport and the newly implemented Sydney Tram Line (expected 2020).   Belmore Road shopping precinct and the famous 'The Spot' are considered your local neighbours making for an easy and convenient time spent with us.  The ever popular Coogee Beach and shops are a short bus ride away, seeing you land in the perfect location for coastal walks, shopping and eateries.   Calm, comfy, carefree - we can't wait to meet you!
transit: Public transport is on our doorstep by with regular buses running daily, seeing equally exciting locations such as the Sydney CBD, Coogee and Bondi right at your fingertips.  The light rail is under construction and will be running in the Randwick area by May 2020.
access: Guests Services is open from 8.00am to 7.00pm daily.  Guests are welcome to check in at anytime during these hours but should be noted that rooms are guaranteed ready from 2.00pm.   Outside of these hours, guest in-house can freely come and go as they please with customised access. Those who wish to check-in outside of guest services hours are most welcome to do so, however, prior arrangements must be made with our team to ensure a smooth and easy arrival. The Alison Randwick provides on-site laundry facilities (additional fee) as well basic kitchen appliances that guests are most welcome to use during their stay.  Covered and secure car parking (additional charge) can be found on site and arranged prior to arrival through our friendly Guests Services Team.
interaction: Our friendly Guest Services team are available 7 days a week, from 8.00 am – 7.00 pm.   With some of the most sought after local relationships, be sure to contact us if there is any additional experiences, reservations or information we can assist with.   Convenient transport options are readily available and can be booked on request.
host_about:
About Us

The Alison Randwick offers affordable accommodation with a variety of room types.

Boutique accommodation styles vary from single, double, and family rooms with shared bathrooms to en-suited options providing well appointed private guest facilities. Secure parking, laundry and a communal kitchenette make The Alison Randwick an accessible and convenient stay in Sydney’s eastern suburbs. We highly recommend The Alison Randwick as a brilliant location for both short and long term stays, and look forward to meeting you soon!

Were we are

Our boutique property is situated on Alison Road, central to various public transport options in Randwick. In just 10 mins you can walk to thriving Belmore Road proving bus transport through to Sydney’s CBD and Coogee beaches, as well in under 5 mins can find yourself with access to Sydney’s newest light rail providing transport through to Circular Quay.

Randwick is well known for its beautiful leafy streets as well popular positioning in relation to some of Sydney’s largest entertainment precincts. The Royal Randwick Turf Club, Moore Park Entertainment precinct, Allianz Stadium and Sydney Cricket Ground are all easily accessible from our guest house by foot, bus or short taxi. This close proximity makes for a very easy stay when Sydney can be at its busiest!

In addition, The Alison Randwick is within a 15min walk to both The University of New South Whales (UNSW) and Prince of Whales and Sydney Children’s hospitals. Students and Corporate travellers are always welcome.

For a more local vibe, we encourage all our guests to check out the many dining and social options throughout Randwick such as the famous Ritz cinema and trendy precinct ‘The Spot’.

name: SAGARO by Palm Beach Holiday Rentals
summary: Revelling in a superb sun drenched setting with expansive ocean views of North Palm Beach, Barrenjoey Lighthouse and Cape Three Points, this stylish private beach house epitomises the Palm Beach lifestyle and is just short stroll to Jonahs restaurant.
space: Surrounded by beautifully manicured gardens, rolling lawns and an in ground pool, this home features seamless transition between living indoors and entertaining outdoors. The upper level has large open plan kitchen, lounge with open Jetmaster sandstone fireplace and dining area. Also on this level is the master bedroom with walk through robe and ensuite with double basins. A vast entertaining terrace with BBQ and separate guest toilet completes this level. On the lower level is the large rumpus room accompanied by a further four bedrooms, full bathroom with shower and bath. There is ample off street parking for 3 to 4 cars. Available for weekends.

space: This lovely light filled two bedroom two bathroom apartment has everything you need for your stay in Sydney. All modern conveniences you need for your home away from home, including king size bed with ensuite, balcony, secure parking, A/C, pool & gym in the complex. Great location for shopping, restaurants and easy access to all forms of transport. Westerly aspect with views over Chinese Gardens and Darling Harbour.  There are great dining options around Darling Harbour. King Street Wharf is a prime nightspot, packed with sleek dining establishments and funky nightclubs. Cockle Bay Wharf offers waterfront promenades with alfresco cafes, bars and restaurants. Some of Sydney's most popular attractions are here; SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium and WILDLIFE Sydney Zoo.  A lively harbourside precinct, Darling Harbour is just a 10-minute walk from Sydney city centre. There is a full calendar of outdoor events as well as one of the city's most restful spots, the Chinese Gardens of Friendship.

neighborhood_overview: Front and centre for all this beautiful city has to offer. Sydney Harbour is one of the most beautiful in the world. Explore the many bars, cafes and restaurants that line the shoreline or take a stroll through the lanes to find one of the many hidden gems. In the city centre you will find large shopping centres with high end stores, Australia Department stores such as David Jones and Myer and many other well knows brands and Australian designers. Located close to the Central CBD is Hyde Park and the Botanical Gardens, both are a beautiful place for a stroll or picnic. The CBD area has many great areas to explore, from Circular Quay and The Rocks, to Barangaroo and Darling Harbour or China Town, there is always somewhere to see. Major Attractions Sydney Harbour Bridge Sydney Opera House Luna Park Art Gallery of New South Wales Bondi Beach Manly Beach Places to Eat Sake – The Rocks Mejico – Central CBD area Mamak – Central CBD area China Lane – Central CBD area Chefs Gallery – Town Hall
notes: A complimentary welcome pack includes a number of single use items to get you started including tea, coffee, sugar, milk, snacks, soap, laundry and dishwashing supplies.  This fully furnished property includes quality amenities and every convenience to ensure you enjoy a comfortable 'home away from home'.  All linen is included in the rental rate. Serviced cleaning is available on request and a departure cleaning charge applies to all bookings.
house_rules: Strictly no subletting without prior written approval from The Apartment Service Please note if stay is longer than 60 days there will be an additional $44 cleaning fee.
host_about:
My team and I at The Apartment Service are proud to have been helping people with short and long stay apartment rentals across Sydney since 1989. 

Property professionals say location is everything and we believe that a convenient location is essential, especially in the rental market. We can offer you some of the best locations accross all the major areas of Sydney, and all of our  apartments are carefully selected for their proximity to cafes, key business and retail districts, public transport, and tourist hotspots.

Furnished apartments are a cost-effective alternative to five star hotels and have the added advantage of feeling like you are staying in your own home with separate lounges, kitchens and laundries, and modern appliances.

We've found Airbnb to be a perfect fit for our apartments and we're proud to have achieved a high volume of 5 star reviews consistently since joining. 

Please don't hesitate to view our 150+ properties listed on Airbnb across all areas of Sydney, and do get in touch for quick and friendly assistance.

name: Bondi Junction, 2 Bed apartment
summary: Spacious, 2 Bed Apartment, modern, comfortably furnished and basking in fantastic district views, this walk-to-the-beach retreat has the best transport connections in the Eastern Suburbs and outstanding shopping and dining at the doorstep.
space: Instantly inviting and relaxing, with plenty of space for kicking back at the end of the day, this is one apartment you'll enjoy waking up in, and coming back to. Stylish and exceptionally well appointed, it features a spacious open plan design, with balconies off the living area and the bedrooms capturing a magnificent bird’s eye view of Sydney from the 5th floor. Enjoy a morning coffee or a glass of wine in the fresh air, gazing out over the leafy Eastern Suburbs and as far as the wide blue sweep of Botany Bay.  Take advantage of an eat-in gourmet kitchen with a dishwasher, a super comfy oversized lounge and flat screen TV with surround sound. You’ll find a queen sized bed in the master bedroom, and a single bed in the second bedroom, along with a bathroom with bath and shower, air conditioning in every room and convenient lift access.

Stylish and exceptionally well appointed, it features a spacious open plan design, with balconies off the living area and the bedrooms capturing a magnificent bird’s eye view of Sydney from the 5th floor. Enjoy a morning coffee or a glass of wine in the fresh air, gazing out over the leafy Eastern Suburbs and as far as the wide blue sweep of Botany Bay.  Take advantage of an eat-in gourmet kitchen with a dishwasher, a super comfy oversized lounge and flat screen TV with surround sound. You’ll find a queen sized bed in the master bedroom, and a single bed in the second bedroom, along with a
neighborhood_overview: Bondi Junction is home to some of the best shopping in Sydney, from high-end fashion at Westfield Bondi to bargain hunting on Oxford Street. You'll soon find your favourite haunts amid the myriad cafes, and there are endless cosmopolitan dining options within a few minutes walk. Beautiful Centennial Park with its ponds, picnic grounds and cycleways is also an easy stroll away.
transit: This is about as convenient as it gets in Sydney’s coastal suburbs. From you’re just a 500m walk to the train station and then 11 minutes by train to the heart of Sydney CBD. World famous Bondi Beach is 2.0km away  – enjoy the leisurely 15 minute walk or catch a bus virtually outside the front door. Be sure to leave some time to explore the equally close beaches of Tamarama and Bronte for a more chilled out affair.
access: The entire fully-furnished apartment is yours for a private stay in the heart of Bondi Junction. Quality linen provided, Kitchen includes every appliance you may need for a super spoiled lifestyle, an internal laundry with detergent supplied. Wifi, Reverse cycle air conditioning/Heating.
interaction: Available on Phone anytime to welcome and instruct on everything in the Apartment and departure catch up and inspection.
house_rules: Please treat our apartment as you would your own and leave it in the same condition you found it it is our home as we let it only when on vacation. Please don't smoke inside - although on the balcony is fine. 2 sets of keys to security building and unit entrance are provided. The same must be returned on check out. AUD 100.00 fee applies for lost keys. Cleaning fee Au$ 150 will apply

Gone are the uphill hikes from the bus stop to the campus Library, food court and lecture halls when you are living right across the road from all three.
space: The apartment itself is fresh, light and bright and comes fully equipped and with brand new furnishings, complete with Foxtel and a plasma TV, Wi-Fi, air-conditioning, towels and linen, and an internal laundry: all the comforts of home wrapped up into a conveniently located, open-plan abode. The art deco style also means polished floorboards, high ceilings and plenty of natural lighting to create a relaxed, warm home environment.

host_about:
Hotelesque provides premium short and long term home hotel accommodation solutions in the most sought-after suburbs of Sydney, Australia. We love looking after guests and our properties are carefully selected  and perfectly presented, with luxury features and quality in-house services to bring the ultimate home-comfort and hotel experience to every stay.
Our personal service and high standard, ensure the best travel experience for all or our guests. Hotelesque is backed by decades of experience and after many years of business travel we started looking for more personal accommodation options. We know that the best feeling when you’re away from home is to find a place with the special touch and convenience that a hotel brings, combined with the comfort and privacy of home. That’s what led us along the journey to Hotelesque.

name: Private room with balcony 5min walk to Manly beach
summary: Private room with balcony, queen bed, bathroom in modern 2 level townhouse situated in quiet street  5 minutes' walk from beach. Nearby shops, cafes and restaurants. Close to buses and ferry. Manly is beautiful - surf beaches and harbour beaches, nature walks, sailing, cycling tracks. Fabulous snorkelling.  There is also another room with two single beds which appears on a separate listing. The two rooms may suit a family. There is one bathroom for these two rooms with an extra toilet downstairs
space: It's a relaxed atmosphere at my place.  It's bright and cheerful and I do my best to make guests feel at home.  Although close to the centre of Manly (15 minutes' walk), it's very quiet and street parking is usually easy (unlike most of Manly) but you will need to ask me for a parking sticker to put in the car.   I provide basic breakfast staples (cereal/toast/tea/coffee) for guests to prepare themselves.  You're welcome to use the washing machine but please ask so I can show you how it works.  Check-in time is reasonably flexible (I'm almost always here to welcome you) but check-out time is 10am (you're welcome to leave your luggage).  It's important to me that you enjoy your stay.
description: Private room with balcony, queen bed, bathroom in modern 2 level townhouse situated in quiet street  5 minutes' walk from beach. Nearby shops, cafes and restaurants. Close to buses and ferry. Manly is beautiful - surf beaches and harbour beaches, nature walks, sailing, cycling tracks. Fabulous snorkelling.  There is also another room with two single beds which appears on a separate listing. The two rooms may suit a family. There is one bathroom for these two rooms with an extra toilet downstairs It's a relaxed atmosphere at my place.  It's bright and cheerful and I do my best to make guests feel at home.  Although close to the centre of Manly (15 minutes' walk), it's very quiet and street parking is usually easy (unlike most of Manly) but you will need to ask me for a parking sticker to put in the car.   I provide basic breakfast staples (cereal/toast/tea/coffee) for guests to prepare themselves.  You're welcome to use the washing machine but please ask so I can show you how it works.
neighborhood_overview: It's only a 5 minute walk to the beach.  It's a long beach which stretches from Manly to Queenscliff.  It's also just a 5 minute walk to the new swim centre if you prefer to swim in a pool.  There are two cafes at the end of the street and restaurants a few minutes further.  Manly centre is only 15 minutes' walk.
notes: We now have a cat - a Russian Blue (it's hypoallergenic).
transit: There is a bus stop at the end of the street (2 minute walk).  Buses will take you either further up the northern beaches or into Manly where you can either take another bus or the ferry to the city.  It's a beautiful ferry ride (30 mins) across the harbour.  If you prefer to walk it's only 20 minutes to the ferry wharf.
access: You are welcome to share the living spaces with me (kitchen area, lounge and deck).  I'm happy for you to cook meals but we may need to co-ordinate our timing.  Your room is upstairs at the front of the house with a bathroom (with shower and toilet) next to it.  I have my own bathroom so won't be using yours.  If the third bedroom is occupied (this happens rarely) they will share your bathroom. There is an extra toilet downstairs.
host_about: I'm quiet but sociable and happy and comfortable sharing my home with guests.  My days are spent with family, friends and swimming.  I am passionate about the ocean and the biodiversity in our local bay where I snorkel most days.  I'm also a traveller - preferring to spend a lengthy period of time in one place rather than just a couple of days in many places.

name: Live the local Surry Hills life
summary: Bedroom in a beautifully renovated  1900s Surry Hills Terrace house. Creative neighbourhood close to all the best cafes & bars & walking distance to Sydney's sights and Central train Station.  (We have a larger room also listed on Air BnB) Long term stays and business trips welcome. Single occupancy only :) Come and live like a Surry Hills local in the best neighbourhood in town...
space: Our amazing terrace is walking distance to everything Sydney has to offer - minutes away from all of Surry Hills cafes, boutiques, markets and art galleries and walking distance to all of Sydney's sights. It is also well connected with public transport and Sydney's main train station if you want to go further afield. **The House**  The house is a large, 4 bedroom terrace. It was recently renovated and features wooden floor boards on the lower levels and modern kitchen. We have a large living room (with TV, Apple TV and couch), a dining room, a large kitchen with gas cooking, large fridge, breakfast table in the sun, a large courtyard with BBQ and outdoor seating, washing/drying machine, 3 bathrooms (2 showers) and 4 bedrooms total. We're on a quiet street right near the main Surry Hills area - so you've got the best of both worlds. Hopefully the photos speak for themselves - but we're happy to explain more if you have any questions! **The Suburb**  Surry Hills is a  popular suburb in S

notes: There will be an empty shelf in the fridge and an empty shelf in the pantry cupboard for your use

But even better than that we are surrounded by attractions and walking in to the city or even to Circular Quay is easy and an interesting walk, so your feet will take you to lots of interesting places - or you can hire a bicycle nearby!
access: Your room is the one straight up the first flight of stairs and straight ahead next to the bathroom.
house_rules: There aren't too many rules but the ones to remember are: - Shoes off to go upstairs - we all leave our shoes downstairs, so your pair can join our happy pairs there :) - The front door does NOT automatically lock behind you - so you need to lock it behind you on both entering and leaving the house - Everyone in the house works, so please be mindful of much noise after 10pm on weeknights - The room is single occupancy, use of the house and the common spaces is for the use of the registered guest only. Single visitors may be allowed with prior permission on occasion, however for liability reasons and to ensure the safety of the house and respect for other occupants  only guests registered may enter the premises. - If you are planning to use the house as your office/home study space during your stay please let me know - I do some work from home, so this needs to be negotiated prior to arrival. I am fine with the occasional day/s of work from home, although using the common areas as a ful
host_about: I lived London for 6 years, but am a Sydney girl through and through. I work in design and teach at colleges and I am currently studying to become an art therapist. I have lived in this house for 4 years and have only had really great experiences through air bnb, both as a host and staying in places myself.

space: Imagine finding a place in Sydney, hidden away, with water views in the middle of the bush. With a unique vehicular ferry. Where you could have a day out fishing on the river, have a relaxing picnic, sit by the water, with a glass of wine and some delicious fish and chips, a restaurant for a great family occasion enjoying fresh seafood or even somewhere you could get married and have a wedding reception to remember for a life time.    Well Berowra Waters Marina and penthouse can offer this and much more.

Number of Guests should not exceed the number stated on the Confirmation Notice or subsequently agreed in writing or email.  Fees will apply for excess guests not agreed with the owners in advance. Parties and Functions are strictly prohibited. The price charged is for domestic use only and not commercial.
